page.title: 09Education, Swainby & Potto
page.content: {The primary school,}Whorlton Parochial was transferred into new premises built in 1969. A Voluntary Aided C of E School, it has 2 teachers plus part-time staff. Meals are cooked in the canteen. It serves Swainby and Potto but numbers have fallen recently and the autumnn term began with 37 children on the roll. In July, 13 left to start at the{Comprehensive School} in Stokesley, a local bus company providing transport. An enlarged governing body of 12 has been set up, and a parents' committee is active in raising money to provide equipment, including a computer.{A Play Group}for under-fives, run by two local mothers, meets three mornings a week in a spare classroom.{An adult education class} meets on Wednesday evenings. A few children attend private schools in the area.
